page.title: 14HALTON HANDBELL RINGERS
page.content: The Halton Handbell Ringers restarted an old tradition in the village in 1979-and in 1985 there are 9 "ringers all ladies of various ages and musical ability. There are 28 bells; from the Loughborough Bell Foundry; half owned by Saint Andrews Church, half by one member. The bells are brass with leather handles and the tunes played on them vary from hymns, carols, folk tunes and extracts from pieces of music such as Handel's Water Music. The ringers play at church services, festivals, charity occasions and clubs such as Women's Institues and Over Sixties. The ringers wear no specific uniform. They practise once a week on a Thursday evening either in the church or a member's home.
